answers.answer: Did you tell your OB? From what I was told, they will prescribe you a pill to take in the evening to help with that.
Mine told me that if my fasting was high I would need to take a long acting insulin at night time to help with that. So I would talk to your doc or endocrinologist whoever is in charge of your GD.
I was put on insulin at night to help fasting number.
I was told to eat a high protein snack right before bed. Cinnamon oil has also helped with my fasting number.

question: I am able to control my food through out the day .. But my fasting is always high does anyone have this issue and how can I solve it I'm 26 weeks pregnant with gestational diabetes. Thanks
title: Fasting is always high
